item.title: Aleia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Mary wished to say something very sensible, but knew not how." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Do not give way to useless alarm; though it is right to be prepared for the worst, there is no occasion to look on it as certain." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Dante Alighieri
item.description: "In that book which is my memory, On the first page of the chapter that is the day when I first met you, Appear the words, ‘Here begins a new life’." -- Dante Alighieri

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "No man can be called friendless who has God and the companionship of good books." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "How do I love thee? Let me count the ways. I love thee to the depth and breadth and height My soul can reach, when feeling out of sight For the ends of being and ideal grace. I love thee to the level of every day's Most quiet need, by sun and candle-light. I love thee freely, as men strive for right. I love thee purely, as they turn from praise. I love thee with the passion put to use In my old griefs, and with my childhood's faith. I love thee with a love I seemed to lose With my lost saints. I love thee with the breath, Smiles, tears, of all my life; and, if God choose, I shall but love thee better after death." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Aleia add a quote by W. H. Auden
item.description: "Among those whom I like or admire, I can find no common denominator, but among those whom I love, I can; all of them make me laugh." -- W. H. Auden

item.title: Aleia add a quote by W. H. Auden
Aleia add a quote by W. H. Auden
item.description: "No opera plot can be sensible, for people do not sing when they are feeling sensible." -- W. H. Auden

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Of all God's creatures, there is only one that cannot be made slave of the leash. That one is the cat. If man could be crossed with the cat it would improve the man, but it would deteriorate the cat." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Aleia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I always deserve the best treatment because I never put up with any other." -- Jane Austen
